div1.p: Hench discusses his upcoming travel plans.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, March 27, 1950
div1.opener:
March 27, 1950
General Walter L. Reed
2810 Thirty Six Place
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Reed:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for your letter of March 18. I just
wanted to let you know I have had no reply to my letter to Mr. Wallach.
Maybe my letter to him was unsatisfactory and I will not hear again but
I will certainly be glad to do anything I can. I wrote to General Kean
and General Truby about the matter and they quite agree with you and me.
I do hope that we can make use of Mr. Wallach's enthusiasm but perhaps
use it in the ways that the Walter Reed Memorial Association would com-
pletely approve.

Mrs. Hench and I shall be in Washington for just a few hours
on the night of April 15. We are quite pleased to be invited to attend
the dinner in honor of the President and Mrs. Truman as given by the
Woman's National Press Association. We will be in New York and will
merely run down for the evening. Doctor Kendall and I are speaking
before the National Academy of Sciences in Washington on Monday,
April 24. I am also speaking that week in Philadelphia and Boston
and fear that I will have to breeze in and out of Washington very
quickly this time.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
